column10: Please describe the incident in your own words
column16: Were weather conditions a likely factor?
column22: Would you be willing to share your contact information with local authorities?
column27: Select one or more NoVA FSS Charters to subscribe to communications:
column28: Do you want to use the same contact information as above?
column33: How did you hear about us?
column34: Please let us know where you heard about us?

column10: I just crossed from the 1st to 2nd of the 4 lanes when a red convertible comes from Braddock, she moved from the 1st lane INTO the 2nd where I was and pick up speed, I jumped to the median just before she zoomed past me no more than 1-2 feet away.

Braddock Rd westbound traffic has bad visibility to a daycare entrance due to curve + foliage. Car exceeding the speed limit in Braddock westbound right lane could not stop in time to avoid car turning out of daycare, had to swerve into left lane.
2 drivers slowed to stop distracted driver had to slam on the breaks - note walker had already crossed 2 of 4 lanes of traffic so car had ample time to see

While crossing Guinea from Olley (4 lanes of traffic) 3 lanes slowed to allow child to cross one truck driver ignored and sped thru barely missing child crossing after school.  Driver honked at child and kept going toward Braddock.
column21: there is a cross walk at this intersection but no signals and 4 lanes to cross.  Intersection is at the bottom of a hill and in one direction also at the end of a curb with visibility obstructed by trees.  We need a pedestrian crossing signal here.

column10: Drivers not slowing or stopping for pedestrians in the crosswalk - this morning my son once again had a driver fly through the intersection while he was trying to safely cross at the crosswalk.  Driver was the only car on the road and didn't slow down at all.  Next time my son will start writing down license plates info
column21: pedestrian was using the cross walk at the intersection - note there are no lights or stop signs at the intersection for traffic on Guinea Rd

column10: People always sped by ignoring pedestrians, especially around 7am when kids are crossing.
